gus_roles¶

models¶

class gus2.gus_roles.models.RoleManager[source]¶
create_role(group, role_name)[source]¶

this will create a new role and insert it into the table

@type group:gus_groups.models.gus_group @param group: the group to associate with the role @rtype:gus_roles.models.gus_role @return: the newly created role

>>>gus_roles.objects.create_role(<gus_group object>,’group_name’) (<gus_role object>)
users_with_group(group)[source]¶

will return all users of a given gus_group @param group: The group to find the users for @type group: L{gus_group<gus2.gus_groups.models.gus_group>} @rtype: List @return: a set of all users that a given group has

Ex. >>>gus_role.objects.users_with_group(group1) (<user1>,<user2>,...,<userN>)
users_without_group(group)[source]¶
with_group(group)[source]¶

will return all roles of a given group

with_user(user)[source]¶

will return all roles of a given user @param user: The user to find the groups for @type user: L{gus_user<gus2.gus_users.models.gus_user>} @rtype: List @return: a set of all groups that a given user belongs to

with_user_in_group(group, user)[source]¶

will return 1 role or false depending on if the given user has a role in the given group

@type group:gus_groups.models.gus_group @param group: the group in question @type user:gus_groups.models.gus_user @param user: the user in question

class gus2.gus_roles.models.gus_role(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

class gus_role is our model of a groupRole it shall encompass both the data and discreet functionality of groupRoles GroupRoles are used to tie users and groups together and to provide permissions within a group context

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception gus_role.MultipleObjectsReturned¶
gus_role.addUser(user)[source]¶

this will add a user to a role @type user:gus_users.models.gus_user @param user:the user to add to the role @rtype: gus_roles.models.gus_role @return: the role , with the new user added to the list

gus_role.permString()[source]¶

return a list of permissions associated with this role

gus_role.removeUser(user)[source]¶

this will remove a user from a role @type user:gus_users.models.gus_user @param user:the user to add to the role @rtype: gus_roles.models.gus_role @return: the role , with the user removed from the list

tests¶

This file demonstrates two different styles of tests (one doctest and one unittest). These will both pass when you run “manage.py test”.

Replace these with more appropriate tests for your application.

class gus2.gus_roles.tests.SimpleTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

class SimpleTest Tests the core functionality of the roles namely the creation /editing/ deletion of roles

setUp()¶

setup a group and a couple users to use with role tests @requires: L{gus_group.create_group<gus2.gus_groups.models.GroupManager.create_group>} @requires: L{gus_user.create_user<gus2.gus_users.models.UserManager.create_user>}

test_addDeleteUser_roles()¶

@summary: test adding and removing users from a roles

@precondition: L{setUp}

tests L{gus_role.addUser<gus2.gus_roles.models.gus_role.addUser>} tests L{gus_role.removeUser<gus2.gus_roles.models.gus_role.removeUser>}

test_createAndDelete_role()¶

@summary: tests that roles can be created

@precondition: L{setUp}

tests built in django model deletion and L{gus_role.create_role<gus2.gus_roles.models.RoleManager.create_role>}
